title: Life-Course Blood Pressure Levels, 38-Year Tracking, and Prediction of Hypertension.
abstract: Elevated childhood blood pressure (BP) levels may persist into adulthood, and persistent exposure to elevated BP since childhood may increase the adulthood risk of hypertension. This study examined the tracking of childhood BP into adulthood over 38 years. We also studied the association between long-term cumulative BP exposure in childhood and adolescence and the risk of developing hypertension in adulthood.
journal: Journal of the American Heart Association
